page.title: 16Transport in N.W.Edinburgh
page.content: Our survey has shown us that the roads which carry most traffic are{Ferry {Road, Pennywell Road}and{West Granton {Road.}These roads are all bus routes and they all carry heavy lorries as well as the usual motor vehicles. This affects{Ecology}because motor vehicles pollute the air. We noted that the busiest times were when people were travelling to and from work (around 09.00 and 17.00 hrs.).{Granton Harbour is used to berth a lot of yachts. There are pilot boats and lighthouse supply ships based there. Although the harbour does not attract a lot of foreign ships, lately there have been regular visits by oil tankers connected with the{North Sea Oil {Fields.}On Tuesday 21st.May 1985 the "Bridgeman" from Granton arrived in Grangemouth to pick up oil.
